title: 9 Ways to Remove the Voicemail Icon from Your Status Bar

steps.title: Turning your Android off and back on might do the trick.
steps.content: Turning your Android off and back on might do the trick. Press and hold your Android's Power button until a menu pops up, then tap the Restart option to prompt your Android to restart. This can help reset processes that are causing the voicemail notification to appear in the top-left corner of your Android's screen. [1] X Research source Depending on your Android, you may have to tap Restart twice to restart it.

steps.title: Doing this will reset every icon in the notifications bar.
steps.content: Doing this will reset every icon in the notifications bar. Unlock your Android and swipe down from the top of the screen to pull down the notifications shade, then tap the Clear option at the bottom. [2] X Research source On some Androids, you'll need to swipe down from the top of the screen with two fingers.

steps.title: Open your Android's voicemail inbox and listen to your messages.
steps.content: Open your Android's voicemail inbox and listen to your messages. If clearing your Android notifications didn't clear the voicemail icon, you'll need to open your inbox to clear out any residual voicemail. You can do this in one of the following ways depending on your Android: Call your voicemail number as specified by your carrier. Tap the Voicemail app icon in your Android's App Drawer. Open the Phone app and tap the icon of a recording tape inside an envelope on the Keypad tab.

steps.title: Delete or save voicemails after listening to move them from the inbox.
steps.content: Delete or save voicemails after listening to move them from the inbox. After each voicemail plays, press the "Delete" or "Save" number as specified by the voicemail inbox. [3] X Research source If your Android has a Voicemail app or if you have Visual Voicemail set up, you should be able to delete a voicemail by long-pressing it and then tapping Delete or the trash can icon (or, in some cases, tapping ⋮ , tapping Edit , tapping each voicemail, and tapping Delete ).

steps.title: Check this setting for your current voicemail notifications.
steps.content: Check this setting for your current voicemail notifications. This could be why you're not seeing the notification when you get a voicemail, or it may be why you always see the notification. Open your voicemail app or tap the voicemail icon in your Phone's Keypad tab, then tap ⋮ > Settings > Notifications . From here, tap the toggle next to "Allow notifications" to turn them off or on.

steps.title: Get rid of possibly corrupted data causing the stuck voicemail icon.
steps.content: Get rid of possibly corrupted data causing the stuck voicemail icon. Clearing the data and cache from Call Settings will often get rid of a voicemail icon. Note that this will remove your data, including "Recent Calls". You will not lose your contacts. Go to Settings > Apps and tap the "Sort by" icon, which looks like a filter icon to the right of "Your apps". Toggle on Show system apps , then tap OK to close the window. Go to Call Settings > Storage. Tap both Clear cache and Clear data .

steps.title: Clearing Phone app data can fix unwanted glitches in the app.
steps.content: Clearing Phone app data can fix unwanted glitches in the app. This means that if a glitch in the Phone app is responsible for causing the voicemail icon to remain stuck in the notifications bar, it will disappear as the corrupted data is deleted. Go to Settings > Apps > Phone > Storage . Tap both Clear cache and Clear data .

steps.title: A glitch can cause the icon to stay stuck in your notification bar.
steps.content: A glitch can cause the icon to stay stuck in your notification bar. If your Android has a Voicemail app, you can clear its cache by selecting the Voicemail app from the list of apps in Settings, tapping CLEAR DATA , and tapping OK or DELETE when prompted.

steps.title: Call your carrier to report the problem.
steps.content: Call your carrier to report the problem. If the voicemail icon still hasn't disappeared from your Android's notification bar, the problem is likely due to an error on your carrier's end. Calling your carrier, reporting the problem, and asking them to clear your voicemail should solve this issue. [4] X Research source You'll need to know your account's login information for your carrier to address voicemail issues. If your carrier can't do anything about the voicemail icon, you may need to factory reset your Android to get rid of it. This will wipe your Android's hard drive, so back up any data you want to save before doing so.
